item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, August 30, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A subset of C kernel developers just seem determined to make the lives of the Rust maintainers as difficult as possible (19 points | 11 comments)
2. The secret inside One Million Checkboxes (72 points | 6 comments)
3. Retiring from the Rust for Linux project (120 points | 158 comments)
4. Elasticsearch is open source, again (25 points | 16 comments)
5. I just crossed $1 million on GitHub Sponsors (58 points | 18 comments)
6. Bypassing airport security via SQL injection (41 points | no comments)
7. GNU Screen v.5.0.0 is released (22 points | 10 comments)
8. Upgrading from GHC 8.10 to GHC 9.6 – An experience report (6 points | no comments)
9. Firewall rules: not as secure as you think (20 points | 3 comments)
10. mup: A micro web file uploader to easily share files over LAN (13 points | 11 comments)
11. Rearchiving 2 million hours of digital radio, a comprehensive process (3 points | no comments)
12. wush - p2p wireguard file transfers, shells, and more (13 points | no comments)
13. Why Playwright is less flaky than Selenium (11 points | 2 comments)
14. Objects Have Not Failed (2002) (18 points | 34 comments)
15. The 2030 Rust Update (31 points | 3 comments)
16. Immutable Systems: NixOS + systemd-repart + systemd-sysupdate (26 points | 10 comments)
17. Introducing Alacrity to Federated Cryptography (26 points | 6 comments)
18. Man vs. AI: optimizing JavaScript (6 points | 2 comments)
19. Meta Bug Bounty — Fuzzing “netconsd” for fun and profit (1 points | no comments)
20. Chat Control: The EU's CSEM scanner proposal (13 points | 5 comments)
21. Python Developers Survey 2023 Results (6 points | no comments)
22. Orphaning bcachefs-tools in Debian (6 points | 2 comments)
23. How we made querying Pandas DataFrames with chDB 87x faster (1 points | no comments)
24. "This Key is Useless Now. Discard?" (42 points | 27 comments)
25. Go sync.Pool and the Mechanics Behind It (11 points | 1 comment)
